explanation: [0-0] A pile of ripe red tomatoes is placed in a metal container, with a hydraulic press fixed above them.

[0-4] The hydraulic press slowly lowers, making contact with the topmost tomato and flattening it. As the press continues to push down, embedding the tomato into the container, it bursts open, spraying pulp and juice out from the gap between the press and the container.

[4-11] The scene changes to a watermelon placed in the metal container. The watermelon is decorated with a pair of eyes and a mouth made of plasticine, resembling a human face. The hydraulic press above slowly lowers, crushing the watermelon and splattering its flesh and juice.

[11-17] The scene switches again, this time featuring a household juicer placed on a disc-shaped metal block. The hydraulic press hangs above and slowly presses down. The juicer starts to crack upon contact with the press, and as the pressure intensifies, it is ultimately destroyed into a pile of debris.
